title: Mile High Misery: Broncos' pass rush too much for Geno Smith, Raiders
content: The Broncos' league-leading pass rush dropped Smith six times, helping Denver to a seventh straight victory.

title: Ex-WR Brown arrested in Dubai, extradited to U.S.
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown was arrested on an attempted murder charge stemming from a shooting after a celebrity boxing event in Miami in May.

title: Broncos admit offense lagging following ugly win
content: Broncos running back J.K. Dobbins was among several players who acknowledged the offense isn't doing the defense "any justice" after an ugly 10-7 win Thursday night over the Raiders.

title: Sources: OF Tucker among 13 to get $22M offer
content: Kyle Tucker (Cubs) and Kyle Schwarber (Phillies) headline the 13 players who were tendered the $22.025 million qualifying offer Thursday, sources told ESPN.

title: Jones enters not guilty plea in NBA gambling case
content: Former NBA player and assistant coach Damon Jones pleaded not guilty Thursday to charges he profited from rigged poker games and provided sports bettors with nonpublic information about injuries to stars LeBron James and Anthony Davis.

title: Gators' 7-9 Rioux becomes tallest college player
content: Florida's 7-foot-9 center, Olivier Rioux, became the tallest person to ever play college basketball when he made his debut in a 104-64 victory over North Florida.

title: Odunze: Dad's shots at Bears don't speak for me
content: Chicago Bears wide receiver Rome Odunze said Thursday that his father's posts on social media are his prerogative, but that they don't speak for him.

title: Kelly: LSU 'journey' fell short of expectations
content: Former LSU coach Brian Kelly shared a statement on social media to fans Thursday, a little more than a week after he was fired.

title: Sources: DePodesta to run Rockies' baseball ops
content: The Rockies are finalizing a deal to hire Paul DePodesta to run their baseball operations department, sources told ESPN, turning to the longtime executive to overhaul a stagnant organization coming off a 119-loss season.

title: ðŸŽ® Mitchell credits 46-point game to NBA 2K troll
content: The Cleveland Cavaliers guard said his 46-point game against the 76ers was powered by an NBA 2K user.

title: The NFL at midseason: Separating the good, bad and ugly for all 32 teams
content: The 2025 season has hit the midway point, and we have things to watch in the second half, key QB stats and fantasy nuggets for all 32 teams.

title: Barnwell's midseason awards: Ranking candidates for MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Which QBs are in the MVP mix? Let's pick three front-runners for seven NFL awards through nine weeks.

title: Cowboys' Kneeland dies in apparent suicide at 24
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland died Thursday morning from an apparent suicide following a police pursuit and vehicle crash, according to authorities.

title: Why was Ja Morant suspended? What's next? What we know about the latest Grizzlies drama
content: Where do things stand between Memphis and its star guard? NBA insiders break down how we got here, and what could come next.

title: Rankings, contract projections for top 50 MLB free agents
content: How much will the biggest stars get paid this winter? Kiley McDaniel breaks down the 2025-26 free agent class.

title: Offseason rumors and buzz: What we're hearing as free agency begins
content: Will Tarik Skubal be dealt? Who could sign Kyle Schwarber and Kyle Tucker? The hot stove is ready to ignite.

title: The best power conference in men's basketball will surprise you
content: Which league will produce the 2026 national champion? We're tracking the power conferences on the road to the Final Four.

title: Five key questions that will shape the 2026 women's NCAA bracket
content: The SEC race and Big Ten's nonconference performance could have the biggest impact on the women's NCAA bracket.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: Lindsey Harding, an incredible journey to the Lakers' bench and an unprecedented next step
content: She was the No. 1 pick in the 2007 WNBA draft. She has played all over the world and coached through triumph and horror. Now, Harding is not only a leading voice for JJ Redick, LeBron and the Lakers, but is on the short list for future NBA head coaches.

title: How Clayton Kershaw's legacy will live on with Dodgers
content: The future Hall of Famer has hung up his spikes, but as L.A.'s dynasty continues, so will his influence.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 10
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Trade, pick up or hold? What to do with these four hot fantasy QBs
content: Not all good fantasy QBs do damage with their legs. We highlight four pocket passers who are thriving.

title: Is the Champions League Arsenal's to lose? Ranking the field, Best XI at midway point
content: We're halfway through the league phase of the UEFA Champions League! Which teams are thriving and which teams are struggling? Bill Connelly offers his stock watch, best XI and power rankings so far.

title: Who's the striker beating MbappÃ©, Haaland in race for European Golden Shoe?
content: Who has been the most lethal forward in Europe this season? A little-known striker in the Latvian league.

title: As the World Cup approaches, can the USMNT impress in final tests of the year?
content: With only months before the start of the World Cup, can the United States -- even with some key absences -- finish the year on a high note?

title: Jayden Daniels' injury echoes past Commanders mistakes, raises larger NFL questions
content: The Commanders QB is one of the league's best young players -- and its most-hit over the past two years.

title: Jake Paul's new fight wish list: Canelo Alvarez, Ryan Garcia, more
content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his original wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list of opponents with ESPN.

title: Can anyone stop Kansas City? How each team will, won't win it all
content: It's playoff time in the NWSL, but can anyone stop the Kansas City Current from cruising to the title? Here's how every team could win it all -- and the one thing that might hold each of them back.

title: What to know ahead of Brazilian Grand Prix sprint weekend
content: Formula 1 has reached round 21 and heads to Interlagos, Brazil for the SÃ£o Paulo Grand Prix. Everything you need to know for the upcoming sprint weekend.

title: Sauce Gardner answers viral video with Colts jersey for young fans
content: A video went viral this week of a father informing his two young sons that one of their favorite players had been traded, with one breaking into tears.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Rodrygo, Yildiz on Spurs' radar
content: Real Madrid's Rodrygo and Juventus' Kenan Yildiz are part of Tottenham Hotspur's ambitious transfer plans. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: How chaos at Mumbai's CMST forced commuters onto tracks; 2 killed by local train
content: Mumbai's Central Railway faced severe disruption as a railway employee protest at CSMT led to overcrowded platforms and stalled trains. Commuters, desperate to get home, walked on tracks near Sandhurst Road, resulting in a tragic accident where two died and three were injured. The protest stemmed from an FIR against engineers in a prior fatal accident.

title: 'US has enough nuclear to blow up world 150 times': Trump says 'we are number 1'; ranks world powers
content: President Trump reiterated his claim of having enough nuclear weapons to "blow up the world 150 times," emphasizing his goal of denuclearization. He stated that the U.S. leads in nuclear capabilities, followed by Russia and China, and suggested leaders like Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin would redirect funds from weapons programs. Trump also confirmed the U.S.

title: 'Became PM by stealing elections': Rahul targets Modi; vows to reveal truth to Gen Z
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of "stealing elections" and vowed to expose this to Gen Z. He presented evidence from the Election Commission, alleging fake votes and photographs, and claimed the BJP and EC are attacking the Constitution. Gandhi highlighted instances of multiple votes by one person and a Brazilian woman's photo being misused.

title: Jakarta: 54 hurt in multiple blasts inside school mosque; probe under way
content: At least 54 people, primarily students, were injured in multiple explosions that rocked a mosque within a high school complex in Jakarta, Indonesia. The blasts occurred during Friday prayers, causing panic and injuries from flying glass shards. Authorities are investigating the cause and have cordoned off the scene.

title: Trump's claims inflated? China still has chokehold on rare earth; what officials say
content: China is introducing a new licensing system for rare earth exports, aiming for a faster and easier process. While this offers longer validity and potentially larger volumes, it does not remove existing restrictions, falling short of US expectations for a full rollback. The new permits are expected before year-end, but obtaining them may remain challenging for certain sectors.

title: No Nvidia, Intel, AMD: China over chip war; claims Trump cannot help
content: China is mandating state-funded data centers to exclusively use domestic AI chips, instructing projects under construction to remove foreign components. This significant move aims to achieve AI chip self-sufficiency, impacting major foreign suppliers like Nvidia, AMD, and Intel. The directive underscores Beijing's accelerating push to reduce reliance on American technology amidst ongoing trade tensions.

title: Gujarat HC grants six month bail to Asaram on health grounds
content: Gujarat High Court granted six months' bail to Asaram, 82, on health grounds for medical treatment. He is serving a life sentence in a 2013 rape case. The court cited a similar directive from the Rajasthan High Court, which had also granted him bail for medical reasons.

title: Aishwarya was sent a tax notice: Here is how she won the Rs 4 cr case
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan won a Rs 4 crore tax case against the Income Tax Department. The ITAT Mumbai ruled in her favor, stating the Assessing Officer failed to properly justify rejecting her voluntary disallowance of Rs 49 lakh. The tribunal found her calculations reasonable and noted inconsistencies in the department's assessment.

title: Far from premium! Passenger finds cockroaches on Gwaliorâ€“Bhopal Vande Bharat Express
content: A passenger on the Vande Bharat Express discovered cockroaches on his seat during a journey from Gwalior to Bhopal. He shared a video online, sparking concerns about hygiene. Railway officials have ordered an investigation into the incident. This marks the first such complaint for the premium train service. The railway administration is taking the matter seriously.

title: Engineersâ€™ biggest 'headache' is now Collins Dictionaryâ€™s Word of the Year 2025
content: Collins Dictionary named "vibe coding" its 2025 word of the year, reflecting the rise of AI-powered app development through natural language. Tech leaders like Sundar Pichai and Garry Tan highlight its efficiency, with major companies like Microsoft and Google already integrating AI into their production code. This shift, however, raises concerns about future demand for software engineers.

title: Man ends life after video of him urinating in public goes viral
content: A 27-year-old man tragically ended his life after facing relentless online harassment and threats over a video. Despite apologizing, the sustained trolling led him to take the extreme step. Police have registered an FIR against seven individuals for abetment of suicide and circulating the damaging content.

title: Influencer walks Tokyo streets in socks; viral test stuns internet
content: A viral experiment saw a Japanese influencer walk Tokyo's streets in white socks, proving their remarkable cleanliness. This demonstration highlights Japan's deep-rooted civic responsibility and community-driven habits, where residents carry their trash, leading to spotless public spaces. The act underscores that cleanliness thrives on collective behaviour, not just infrastructure, captivating global viewers.

title: Itâ€™s all meaningless: Why prestige no longer satisfies young talent; culture matters
content: Many young professionals are rethinking their career choices. The allure of prestigious Big 4 firms like PwC, Deloitte, EY, and KPMG is fading. Employees report long hours, slow promotions, and a feeling of being undervalued. This trend reflects a broader shift where younger generations prioritize work-life balance, meaningful work, and genuine growth over brand names alone.

title: Peter Thielâ€™s warning resurfaces: What he predicted about Zohran Mamdani?
content: Tech titan Peter Thiel warned Silicon Valley in 2020 that rising millennial support for socialism stemmed from economic hardship, not ideology.  His foresight appears validated by Zohran Mamdani's election as New York's first Muslim and South Asian mayor on a platform of housing affordability and debt relief, highlighting a growing demand for alternatives to a perceived rigged capitalist system.

title: 'Lalu's son will open Apaharan dept': Shah cautions Bihar voters; raises 'jungle raj' spectre
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah warned Bihar voters against the opposition Mahagathbandhan, alleging they would establish an "Apaharan (kidnapping) ministry" if they win. He contrasted this with the NDA's promise to make Bihar flood-free and asserted that lawlessness would not return under their rule.

title: â€˜They came from ponds': 40 crocodiles rescued from Haridwar homes and fields
content: Freshwater crocodiles, mostly juveniles, have been rescued from homes and farmlands in Haridwar and Laksar this monsoon, causing fear among residents. Officials believe these reptiles, now adults, originated from local ponds and reservoirs, entering residential areas in search of food.  Villagers are concerned for their children's safety and have requested that rescued crocodiles not be released back into the Ganga.

title: Mumbai terror trail: Flats once used for 1993 blasts meeting to be auctioned
content: Properties linked to 1993 Mumbai blasts accused Tiger Memon and his family, including a conspiracy meeting site, are slated for auction. Authorities have seized eight properties, with more in legal processes. Valuations are underway for these assets, with auctions anticipated in December or January, offering a glimpse into the aftermath of the devastating attacks.

title: Air India crash: SC tells pilotâ€™s father â€˜you shouldnâ€™t carry burden on yourselfâ€™
content: The Supreme Court has stated that the pilot-in-command of the Air India Boeing Dreamliner that crashed in Ahmedabad, killing 260 people, is not to be blamed. The apex court assured the pilot's 91-year-old father that his son is not at fault, calling the incident an accident. A notice was issued to the Centre and DGCA regarding the father's plea for a fair investigation.

title: Vande Mataram song row: PM Modi says key stanzas removed in 1937; Kharge hits out at BJP, RSS
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the 1937 Congress government of removing stanzas from Vande Mataram, claiming it fractured the song and sowed seeds of partition. He emphasized the song's enduring inspiration for nation-building and highlighted India's civilisational ethos of the nation as a mother and Shakti.

title: PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi reaches Dubai for ICC Board meeting
content: Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi has arrived in Dubai for the ICC Board meeting, where the BCCI is expected to raise the issue of the delayed Asia Cup trophy handover. BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia reiterated their intention to escalate the matter to the ICC if the trophy isn't returned promptly.

title: Delhi chokes again: AQI at 311 with 26 of 38 stations in â€˜very poor zone
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category on Friday, with the city-wide AQI hitting 311. Bawana recorded the highest pollution levels at 366. Meanwhile, the minimum temperature dipped to 12.7Â°C, and shallow fog is expected to persist, impacting visibility across the capital.

title: Jubilee Hills bypolls: Bandi Sanjay slams CM Revanth Reddy for skull cap; sparks row
content: Union minister Bandi Sanjay sparked controversy during a poll rally, urging Hindus to unite and accusing Congress and AIMIM of appeasement politics. He criticized leaders for perceived religious gestures for votes and alleged a plot to turn Telangana into an Islamic state, calling for a Hindu vote-bank.

title: India's citizenship test? Chhetri tests ex-Aussie Ryan before handing passport - watch video
content: Former Australian winger Ryan Williams is now an Indian citizen, a landmark for Indian football.  Sunil Chhetri presented his passport, marking the AIFF's first success with OCI players. Williams, eligible through his Anglo-Indian heritage, impressed with his cultural knowledge.  His move could bolster the national team for upcoming qualifiers.

title: Animal rights activist fumes over SC directive to remove stray dogs
content: Animal rights activist Gauri Maulekhi criticized the Supreme Court's order to remove stray dogs from public places, calling it a sweeping directive passed without hearing all parties. She argued the order is impractical and will disrupt existing animal welfare systems, potentially worsening the problem.

title: 'Our bundle of joy': Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal welcome baby boy
content: Bollywood stars Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal are celebrating the arrival of their baby boy, born on November 7, 2025. The couple shared the joyous news on social media, expressing immense love and gratitude. This marks the beginning of a new chapter for the beloved pair, who had previously announced their pregnancy in September with a heartwarming picture.

title: Injured WWE star spotted at Stranger Things Season 5 premiere in rare appearance
content: WWE's Liv Morgan made a rare public appearance at the Stranger Things season five premiere in Los Angeles, months after suffering a major shoulder injury on RAW. The former Women's Champion, sidelined since June, is expected to be cleared for in-ring action by January 2026, potentially making a surprise return at the Royal Rumble.

title: Murder on Sabarmati Express: Army jawan stabbed to death after argument over blanket
content: An Army jawan was fatally stabbed on the Sabarmati Express following a dispute with an AC attendant over a blanket. Police have arrested the attendant and recovered a knife. Investigators are struggling to find eyewitnesses as the train passed through multiple stations, making passenger identification difficult.

title: 'Sorry. Can't live with them anymore': Telangana woman kills self over fear of ants
content: A 25-year-old woman in Sangareddy district allegedly died by suicide due to a severe childhood fear of ants. She reportedly took the extreme step after noticing ants while cleaning her home. Her husband discovered her after returning from work, and a suicide note was found.

title: 3 crocodiles drag Rajasthan man into Chambal river
content: A 37-year-old man from Rajasthan was tragically dragged into the Chambal River by three crocodiles in Madhya Pradesh. Despite a four-day intensive search by police and SDRF teams, no trace of Roop Singh Gurjar was found, and operations were officially called off. The incident occurred near a religious site, highlighting a lack of safety measures despite frequent crocodile sightings.

title: Xi in US: Chinese president shares light moment with Trump â€” Why China will never see these images
content: Rarely seen smiling, Chinese President Xi Jinping's stoic image was unexpectedly challenged by candid White House photos.  These images captured him in lighter moments with Donald Trump and during a humorous exchange in South Korea, a stark contrast to his tightly controlled public persona.  Back home, state media focused on his authoritative image, highlighting the opacity of elite politics.

title: Gold price in your city: Check rates for 22k and 24K gold in Delhi, Mumbai and more
content: Gold futures surged on Friday, marking their third consecutive session of gains due to weak US economic data. This data has intensified expectations of an imminent interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve, driving investors towards safe-haven assets like bullion. Silver prices also advanced alongside gold.

title: Deepfake scam: B'luru police probe AI videos of Kohli, Nirmala Sitharaman; case filed
content: Bengaluru cybercrime police have filed a suo motu case against unidentified individuals for creating and circulating AI-generated deepfake videos. These videos falsely depict prominent personalities like Virat Kohli and Nirmala Sitharaman endorsing fraudulent stock trading platforms and online games, aiming to lure unsuspecting victims into investment scams.

title: Lenskart IPO: Ahead of listing, GMP plunges 70%; what analysts are saying
content: Lenskart's IPO grey market premium has plummeted by 70% ahead of its listing, raising concerns about substantial listing gains despite strong oversubscription. While the company boasts a robust business model and impressive financial growth, elevated valuations and subdued secondary market conditions are prompting caution among investors and market observers.

title: 'Had a habit of ...': Bangladesh bowler alleges indecent behaviour by ex-selector; BCB investigates
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has formed a committee to probe allegations of inappropriate behaviour by a former selector against ex-pacer Jahanara Alam during the 2022 ODI World Cup. Alam detailed lewd questions and unwanted physical advances, claiming multiple officials acted improperly. The board vows swift action after a 15-day investigation.

title: Before electricity humans slept twice nightly â€” scientists explain why
content: Before electricity, humans naturally slept in two phases, waking for an hour or two around midnight for quiet activities. This biphasic sleep pattern, influenced by natural light cycles and melatonin, was a common and restorative practice. Industrialization and artificial light disrupted this rhythm, leading to the single, continuous sleep pattern prevalent today.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Not Bumrah anymore': Ashwin reveals who teams will fear most in Indiaâ€™s T20 squad
content: India took a 2-1 lead against Australia in their T20I series. Former spinner R Ashwin highlighted Abhishek Sharma and Varun Chakaravarthy as key targets for opposition teams in the upcoming T20 World Cup. Ashwin noted Australia's effective strategy against Sharma, aiming to limit his powerful off-side shots.

title: â€˜Confirmed chaal, charitra, chehraâ€™: PK reacts to attack on Bihar dy CMâ€™s convoy; claims â€˜nobody safeâ€™
content: Prashant Kishor slammed Bihar's deteriorating law and order after Deputy CM Vijay Sinha's convoy was attacked. Kishor stated Sinha's remarks confirmed the ruling NDA government's failure, asserting no one is safe. The incident saw Sinha accuse RJD supporters of stone-pelting and cow dung attacks, prompting the Election Commission to demand immediate action against miscreants.

title: Russia crude available at highest discount in a year; India, China cut purchases
content: India and China, major buyers of Russian crude, have significantly reduced their oil purchases following new US sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil. This has widened the price gap between Russian Urals and Brent crude in Asia to a year-high, signaling increasing pressure on Russia's vital oil revenues. Refiners in both nations have halted December orders, risking unsold Russian oil volumes.

title: Dak Prescott pays tribute to teammate Marshawn Kneeland on emotional day
content: Dallas Cowboys star Dak Prescott is grappling with the tragic death of teammate Marshawn Kneeland, who reportedly died by self-inflicted gunshot wound after a police chase. This devastating loss echoes Prescott's own experience, having lost his older brother Jace to suicide in 2020. Prescott expressed profound grief and urged loved ones to cherish each moment.

title: Babar Azam vs Virat Kohli | Pak batter makes shocking claim - 'Huge difference!'
content: Pakistani cricketer Azam Khan has drawn a comparison between Babar Azam and Virat Kohli. Khan stated Babar elevated Pakistan's batting reputation like Kohli did for India. He also noted Babar lacked support from senior players unlike Kohli. Khan believes Pakistani fans do not fully appreciate Babar's contributions. He also agreed with Suryakumar Yadav's comment on the India-Pakistan 'rivalry'.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Makes no sense!' Ex-India cricketer furious over Sanju Samsonâ€™s treatment
content: Aakash Chopra has criticized India's management for their inconsistent handling of Sanju Samson. Despite decent performances, Samson has been shuffled and dropped, with Jitesh Sharma now preferred. Chopra questions the logic behind Samson's exclusion, especially after his strong showings as an opener.

title: Indian MBBS student found dead in Russian dam; was missing for 19 days
content: A 22-year-old Indian MBBS student, Ajit Chaudhary, missing for 19 days from Russia's Bashkir State Medical University, was found dead in a dam near the campus. His body was identified by fellow students, ending a desperate search that began after his clothes were found on a swollen riverbank. The family had sold land to fund his education.

title: Moments after $1 trillion pay nod: Musk breaks into dance with robot â€” who did it better?
content: Elon Musk celebrated a monumental Tesla payday, potentially worth $1 trillion, after shareholders overwhelmingly approved his compensation package. The deal, which could make him the world's first trillionaire, aims to secure his leadership for years, driving Tesla's ambitions in AI and robotics.  Despite controversies, investors backed Musk's vision, though critics raise concerns about concentrating so much power.

title: Congress to collect 5 crore signatures to highlight â€˜vote choriâ€™ across India: MLC Manjunath Bhandary
content: Manjunath Bhandary said Congress party leader Rahul Gandhi had held press conferences divulging details of the theft of votes during elections

title: BJP misusing 'Vande Mataram' anniversary for political polarisation, hypocritical nationalism: Congress
content: The Congress refuted the BJP's reported allegations that any of its party legislators had opposed the singing of 'Vande Mataram'

title: Telanganaâ€™s revenue receipts reaches 43% of FY 2025-26 estimates in 6 months
content: Borrowings and other liabilities constitute major chunk of receipts crossing â‚¹45,000 crore mark. Interest payment reaches 74% of projection

title: Excise files chargesheet against Malayalam filmmakers in ganja case
content: Chargesheet against directors Khalid Rahman, Ashraf Hamsa and Sameer Thahir and their friend Shalif Muhammad. Punishment, if the charges are proven, could be limited to fine since case involves only small quantity of suspected ganja

title: â€˜Ithiri Neramâ€™ movie review: Roshan Mathew and Zarin Shihab ace in a deeply-felt conversational drama
content: With â€˜Ithiri Neramâ€™, Prasanth Vijay crafts a deeply felt conversational drama with an uncommon turn.Â

title: Sengottaiyan accuses Palaniswami of allowing dynastic politics, weakening AIADMK by expelling â€˜anyone who speaks their mindâ€™
content: Speaking to reporters in Gobichettipalayam, Mr. Sengottaiyan said uniting those who had â€œdrifted awayâ€ from the party and bringing together committed cadres were essential to revive the ideals of M.G.R. and Jayalalithaa

title: Kurnool bus accident: V Kaveri bus owner arrested
content: During investigation, police found several violations in the design of the bus and also failure to adhere to basic safety guidelines by the bus management

title: 14 waste collection vehicles purchased by Kochi Corporation over a decade ago remain untraceable for auction
content: As per a report by mechanical engineer of Corporationâ€™s vehicle cell, out of 44 four-wheelers that are no longer usable even with maintenance, location of 14 could not be identified

title: Mammootty-starrer â€˜Bramayugamâ€™ set to be screened at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures
content: Earlier this week, the film directed by Rahul Sadasivan, had won multiple awards at the Kerala State Film Awards 2024

title: Army detains Bangladeshi national working as civilian labourer at military station in Bengal
content: During the reverification drive, the individual aroused suspicion. On further scrutiny, he was found to be carrying identity documents issued by the Bangladesh government, an official said.

title: Gouri Kishan calls out journalist for sexist question about her weight, film industry condemns reporter
content: The â€˜Othersâ€™ actorâ€™s firm stand against body-shaming at a press event ignited support from Pa Ranjith, Khushbu, Kavin and more

title: Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan to visit Shravanabelgola on November 9
content: Abhinava Charukeerthy Bhattaraka Swamy of the mutt told mediapersons that a 10.5 feet tall statue of Shantisagara Maharaj would be installed on the hillock next to Vindhyagiri on November 9

title: Man wanted for double murder shot at by police, arrested in Salem
content: The police said the accused, who has been accused of killing two women earlier this week, faced several cases of murder in the past and was even convicted in a couple of them

title: NGT halts waste dumping at Jawahar Nagar facility; over 38,000 tonnes waste in and around Hyderabad could remain uncollected
content: Jawahar Nagar processing facility receives an average of 9,684 metric tonnes of solid waste every day

title: Kerala govt medical college doctors to strike on November 13
content: Strike to press various long-pending demands, including salary revision and creation of new posts. However, emergency hospital services to function on the day

title: Womenâ€™s World Cup star Shree Charani meets Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu; felicitated
content: Following the teamâ€™s historic victory, Indian cricketer Shree Charani and former Indian captain Mithali Raj visited Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu

title: Karnataka tiger attacks: Forest Minister orders closure of safari in Bandipur and Nagarahole
content: Trekking in humanâ€“wildlife conflict zones suspended until further orders; all available forest personnel to be deployed for tiger capture operation, says Minister Eshwar Khandre

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF finalises seat-sharing in Kozhikode Corporation
content: Of the 76 divisions in the Corporation, the Congress will contest in 49, while IUML will contest in 25. Communist Marxist Party will contest in two divisions

title: Rahul Gandhi renews vote theft charge, attacks PM Modi
content: You should note that all the allegations put forth by me - fake votes, fake photographs, no response to them has come from the EC and the BJP is defending the EC. But, they are not negating what I have said, says Rahul Gandhi

title: Global MSME Export Development Convention 2025 in Visakhapatnam on November 9, 10
content: It is a part of the Reverse Buyer-Seller Meet initiative of the Central Governmentâ€™s RAMP Scheme which is supported by the World Bank

title: Elon Musk's Starlink to start services in India, beginning with Maharashtra
content: In March, India's biggest telecom service providers, Jio Platforms and its rival Bharti Airtel, announced deals with SpaceX to offer Starlink internet to their customers

title: Kerala teenagerâ€™s harrowing experience on moving train highlights urgent need for safety reforms
content: The plight of Sreekutty, who was booted off a train by an allegedly inebriated fellow passenger, has resonated among the travelling public, especially women transiting alone on commuter trains running largely empty at night. It has sparked a strident demand for gender-sensitive policing of public spaces

title: MP Police mandates Bhagavad Gita sessions for constables under training
content: The ADG (Training) had directed the recital of Ramcharitmanas at these institutions while inaugurating their training session in July

title: Sporadic sit-ins at TATA Electronics hostel campus in Hosur; police team flies to Bihar
content: Contrary to the arrested accused womanâ€™s earlier accounts that she was forced into the crime by her male friend, she had consented in order to make money, a police source told The Hindu.

title: Firecrackers banned due to security concerns in J&Kâ€™s Poonch
content: Acting on the recommendation by the senior superintendent of police, Poonch, the district magistrate invoked Section 163 of the BNSS to enforce the ban with immediate effect till further orders.

title: The Hindu Sustainability Summit 2025: â€˜Tamil Naduâ€™s vision for sustainability will become blueprint for nationâ€™
content: While speaking at the inauguration of the Sustainability Summit 2025 organised by The Hindu, Srivats Ram, immediate past chairman of CII Tamil Nadu and managing director of Wheels India, said, the State has been at the forefront of renewable energy for many years

title: Congress proud flagbearer of 'Vande Mataram': Kharge
content: Vande Mataram rose as a song of unflinching strength, uniting all Indians in devotion to Bharat Mata, says Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge

title: â€˜No one in India believes it was the pilotâ€™s faultâ€™: SC says Air India crash report does not insinuate anything against pilot
content: On June 12, Air India Flight AI-171 had crashed shortly after take-off from Ahmedabad killing 265 people, including 241 passengers and crew, 19 persons on the ground, and five others who later succumbed to injuries

title: ED makes 3rd arrest in Reliance Power 'fake' bank guarantee linked PMLA case
content: A person identified as Amar Nath Dutta was taken into custody on Thursday (November 6) under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

title: Supreme Court orders removal of stray dogs from schools, hospitals, other public institutions
content: The top court said that permitting the return of the canines would â€œfrustrate the very purposeâ€ of keeping such premises secure and ensuring public safety

title: ED raids in prostitution linked PMLA case in West Bengal

title: India May Become 3rd Pillar In US-Japan Rare Earth Network: Analysis
content: India has significant raw-material potential- its beach-sand deposits contain rich reserves of monazite, bastnaesite, and other rare-earth minerals, but the country's processing capacity and environmental rules have lagged.

title: Music Site Stereogum Shares Zohran Mamdani's 2017 Song Coverage Mail After His Mayoral Win
content: In 2017, Zohran Mamdani emailed music website Stereogum requesting coverage for his song "Salaam," which focused on the experiences and challenges of being Muslim in the US.

title: "Bihar Rejected RJD's Package Of Lies": PM Modi After Record Phase 1 Polling

content: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that Iran has been asking if US sanctions against the country can be lifted.

content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said he expects the automaker's Full Self-Driving software, a driver assistance system, will be fully approved in China early next year.

title: Rs 5,700 Crore 'Water Secure Haryana' Programme To Be Launched
content: The Haryana Government plans to launch the ambitious 'Water Secure Haryana' Program, a landmark initiative of about Rs 5,700 crore, of which around Rs 4,000 crore will be supported by the World Bank under its Program-for-Results framework.

title: Mercedes Catches Fire On Delhi Road, Cops Rescue Woman, 5-Year-Old Child
content: The Mercedes car suddenly caught fire as the woman and her child were waiting for the signal to turn green. However, Delhi Police's prompt action led to their safe rescue.

content: The Delhi Police on Wednesday solved a 15-year-old criminal case and arrested a man from Gujarat for murdering his wife.

title: Probe Agency ED Arrests Kolkata-Based Consultant In Reliance Power Fraud Case
